content.title: Continuous Wave Doppler
content.description: Use of CW Doppler for intraoperative vascular assessment

key_concepts.details: Continuous transmission and reception of ultrasound; detects blood flow velocity
Quick assessment of flow after anastomosis; signal quality indicates patency
No anatomic information; cannot identify specific stenosis location
Triphasic or biphasic signal indicates good flow; monophasic or absent concerning

content.clinical_significance: Simple bedside tool for quick flow assessment
content.statement: Continuous Wave Doppler is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Continuous Wave Doppler helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Continuous Wave Doppler include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Continuous Wave Doppler.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Continuous Wave Doppler. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
